column5: I did mine the year it was anounced at the sportmen show for a whole $10  I look brilliant now!  LOL!!!!

i did too ...got one wrong on the test and to this day i still dont know what the colour pattern to a cordial bouy is ...??? yellow black yellow ? black yellow black??? or all yellow? heck ill still dont know what a cordial bouy is let alone the colour..

I got one wrong too  guess which one   how do you don a life vest, I got it wrong LOL!!!!  they all looked right, but they wanted your head through first before yours arms LOL!!!  the guy actually said alot of guys go this wrong but all the harder technical stuff right LOL!!!
We hold Alabama intelligence in such high regard up here
Link is still valid, i just registered.
My BIL did his on line and printed out the card online for $49 plus tax.......but his card is about the size of your thumb.......did he get a real card or what ? ? ?
He got a temporary card 'til the permanent one arrives in the mail. It's good for 90 days.
LOL.......he had it laminated and everything.........ha ha ha ha  I'll have a good laugh tonight at the fire hall on his account........
I got my plastic cards in the mail 10 days after writing the course, and I haven't checked the mailbox since Friday. That's pretty good.  JF
Mine came fairly quick as well. Was surprised to receive so quick.
Did my test last week. I searched boater card and found an old link that let me do the test for $25
Wow, the cheapest I could find was $45  I wouldnt get to happy until you get it in the mail...lol   Maybe you got scammed  Just kidding.
I did mine for like $27 CAD.  There was a link on this forum to do it, and I followed it
I pushing almost 2 months .... not sign of a card yet... still running on my yellow copy.   RFS
Where did you get yours Randy? The other day I ran across a list of companies testing who had gone out of business.
Got at the local MTO Office they offered the course.   40$

Best thing I ever did with respect to boating was taking a Power and Sail Squadren course back in 1980. When the card thing started happening I called and got my card in a week. Call it what you want but I think it's a good idea.
Well there you go, MTO is government and they're bankrupt aren't they?
Morally - that's morally bankrupt. As long as they have us all to pay taxes they'll hopefully never be bankrupt. Of course that all flies out the window once they bankrupt each of us.  JF
Got mine about 3 days after I took the test.  Paul is coming on two weeks now without his.  Joey
Does that mean you have to drive Paul around
That's why I vote Libertarian.   :lol:
Can either of you tell me where you found these prices?
http://www.theoperatorcard.ca/event.php  $24.95.  Not sure if its still Valid though.
Thats the one.
I wrote the Operator Card test on the 14th and paid $40 or so.  JF
You have to go through that special link, otherwise it is the full amount.
Changing boat registration to an Ontario Corp # = Free  Rental agreements.. 2 pieces of paper and some ink.
Brilliant!
I got mine 10 years ago... and I thought Alabama was behind in the times!!!... HA!!!
i got mine within pretty much a week or so.  went through  operatorcard.com or whatever it was.  paid just under 40 bucks too
I still do
... and now that intelligent thing you said a while back has slipped from my mind and we're back to page one... Hoser!!!
